intro: Sida ogadensis, commonly known as desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a shrub or herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are usually oval or lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, adapted to reduce water loss. Sida ogadensis is known for its resilience to drought and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
